column1: Eintracht Frankfurt is actively pursuing a deal for 19-year-old VfL Bochum midfielder Cajetan Lenz this winter transfer window, with plans for him to join in the summer, amid competition from clubs like Bayer Leverkusen.[3][1][5] Frankfurt has held recent talks with both the player and Bochum, who are demanding a transfer fee of €10-15 million, potentially a record sale for Bochum.[3][1][5]

Rennes have officially signed Sebastian Szymanski from Fenerbahce for €9.5 million, according to Transfermarkt data reported across sources.[1] In the 2025/2026 season, Szymanski made 26 appearances for Fenerbahce across all club competitions before the transfer.[1]

Paris FC are in talks with Brighton & Hove Albion to sign Italian defender **Diego Coppola (22)** on loan during the January 2026 transfer window.[5][6] According to reports from Marc Mechenoua and Matteo Moretto, the Ligue 1 side has held positive contacts with Brighton and aims to finalize the deal quickly.[1][5][6]

**Key details:**
- Coppola, under contract with Brighton until June 2030, has made 9 appearances this season (5 in the Premier League, 4 in cups).[2][6]
- Paris FC emerged as surprise contenders, ahead of interest from Girona, Valencia, AC Milan, Fiorentina, and Torino.[1][2][3][4]
- An entourage member confirmed Coppola 'will not go to Milan', pointing to Paris FC as the likely destination.[4]
- No specifics on loan terms (e.g., option to buy) have been disclosed.[1][3]

**Aston Villa and Crystal Palace are interested in signing PSG striker Gonçalo Ramos (24), who is currently a backup option at the club.** According to reports, Aston Villa is actively working to bring the Portuguese international to Villa Park before the winter transfer window closes, amid a need for a centre-forward replacement after Donyell Malen's departure to Roma.[1][3][5] Crystal Palace is also pursuing Ramos as a potential replacement for Jean-Philippe Mateta, who wants to leave.[1][3]

**PSG is reluctant to sell Ramos.** The French champions do not want to part with him despite his limited playing time behind players like Ousmane Dembélé, and they are focused on keeping or renewing his contract.[1][2][5]

**Additional context:** Aston Villa has other striker targets like Tammy Abraham (personal terms agreed) and Mateta, with Ramos as one option on a shortlist.[1] Other clubs, including Atlético Madrid, have shown interest in Ramos for a potential summer move as a replacement for players like Julián Álvarez.[2][4][6] Ramos had a successful 2025 with PSG, contributing to their sextuple win.[7]

Olympique Marseille has officially signed Dutch international midfielder **Quinten Timber** from Feyenoord on a permanent transfer for approximately **€4.5 million** plus performance-related bonuses, with a contract until **2030**[1][2][3][6][7][10][11]. The 24-year-old (born 2001), twin brother of Arsenal defender Jurriën Timber, arrived in Marseille on Wednesday, passed his medical, and the deal was announced on Friday[1][2][3][5].

**Key Details:**
- **Background:** Timber made 125 appearances for Feyenoord, scoring 21 goals, including in their 2023 Eredivisie title win; this season, 24 appearances, 4 goals, 4 assists[5][9]. He debuted for Netherlands in 2024 with 8 caps and 1 goal, eyeing the 2026 World Cup[2][5].
- **Transfer Context:** His Feyenoord contract expired in summer 2026; tensions with coach Robin van Persie led to his exit despite extension offers. He rejected interest from Premier League clubs, Borussia Dortmund, Lazio, Napoli, RB Leipzig, choosing Marseille for playing time and development[1][2][3].
- **Marseille's View:** Club calls him one of the most promising midfielders; strengthens squad under Roberto De Zerbi, third in Ligue 1, ahead of Lens match where he could debut alongside loanee Ethan Nwaneri[3][4][5][7].

Marseille's official site confirms the signing from Feyenoord Rotterdam[7]. Reports consistently value the fee at €4.5m, with minor variations on bonuses[1][2][3][10][11].

Luka Vušković is a Tottenham Hotspur loanee who has rapidly risen as a leading Bundesliga defender for Hamburg, dominating rookie honors, defensive awards, and earning Team of the Season and Player of the Season nominations.[1][2] The  Croatian international center-back made his professional debut at age 16 and has shone from the start of the season, showcasing tools to become a top star akin to Sergio Ramos.[1][3] Tottenham eyes him as a future first-team replacement for defenders like Cristian Romero or Micky van de Ven, though Bayern Munich interest prompts contingency plans like Jacobo Ramon.[1]

Napoli are reportedly closing in on a deal to sign Hellas Verona's 22-year-old Brazilian forward Giovane Nascimento (also referred to as Giovane) for around €20 million, including add-ons, positioning them ahead of rivals Lazio.[1][4][5][7] The versatile attacker, capable of playing across the front line, joined Verona from Corinthians last summer and has impressed in his first full Serie A season with his pace, technique, and a notable goal against Inter Milan, though he remains raw and inconsistent in finishing.[1][3][6]

Verona's asking price is €20m, and Napoli's pursuit depends on outgoing transfers, particularly Noa Lang's imminent loan to Galatasaray with an option to buy (valued at €32m), which will free up space and funds.[1][3] Lazio have been negotiating longer, including talks over a swap with Reda Belahyane, but Napoli have accelerated, making enquiries since November and now leading the race per multiple reports.[2][3][5]

Other Napoli targets include Betis' Abdessamad Ezzalzouli, while potential exits like Lorenzo Lucca to Nottingham Forest are also in play.[1] Sources like Corriere dello Sport, Alfredo Pedullà, and Nicolo Schira support Napoli's strong position, with some claiming the deal is on the verge of completion.[1][3][5][7]

Thomas Kessler has been promoted from sporting director to **sporting managing director** at 1. FC Köln, with a new contract signed until 2028.[1][2][6] In this expanded role, the 40-year-old former professional goalkeeper and club youth product will oversee the men’s team, scouting, and additional responsibilities as part of the club's trio of managing directors.[1] The promotion was officially confirmed by FC Köln recently, following reports of it being imminent.[3][5] Other changes include an extended contract for the head of finance and Philipp Türoff taking an expanded role as CEO.[1][4]

Rennes head coach Habib Beye has reiterated his wish to rely on France U21 international centre-back Jérémy Jacquet (20) until the end of the season, amid interest from Chelsea, who are seeking a club-to-club agreement but face complications over Rennes' high asking price of around €65-70m (£60m).[4][1][3]

**Key Details on Jeremy Jacquet Transfer Situation:**
- **Player Profile:** 20-year-old French under-21 international centre-back at Rennes, with 16 Ligue 1 appearances this season, contract until 2029, and Transfermarkt value of €20m.[3][1]
- **Chelsea's Interest:** Chelsea have held positive discussions with Rennes and reportedly agreed personal terms with Jacquet, making him their primary centre-back target in January 2026. No official bid yet; a €50m offer was reportedly rejected. They are reluctant to meet the full price and consider a buy-and-loan-back deal.[1][2][3]
- **Rennes' Stance:** Demanding €65-70m to make Jacquet their biggest sale ever; Habib Beye wants to keep him until season's end.[4][2][3]
- **Other Clubs:** Interest from Arsenal, Manchester United, Liverpool, Real Madrid; situation complicated with ongoing talks.[2][3]
- **Fabrizio Romano Update:** Positive player-side talks but no club agreement; Chelsea exploring alternatives like recalling Aaron Anselmino.[1][2]

Lucas Bergvall, Tottenham Hotspur's Swedish midfielder, suffered a high ankle sprain during the UEFA Champions League match against Borussia Dortmund on Tuesday, forcing him off after 63 minutes.[1][2] Tottenham manager Thomas Frank stated the injury 'could be a longer one,' with further assessment pending in the next couple of days, confirming a prolonged period on the sidelines.[1][2] This follows Bergvall's recent unfitness to play significantly against West Ham due to prior issues.[2]

Harry Wilson's contract talks with Fulham are currently on hold. The 28-year-old Welsh international is in the final months of his deal at Craven Cottage, set to expire at the end of the 2025-2026 season, with no agreement reached despite Fulham prioritizing an extension.[1][3][4][6]

Fulham have shelved negotiations amid growing interest from other Premier League clubs, including Everton, Aston Villa, Brentford, Crystal Palace, and Leeds United.[1][2][5] Wilson has had a strong season, scoring seven goals in 21 Premier League appearances, making him a target for a potential move before the February 2, 2026 transfer deadline or in the summer.[1]

Juventus are interested in signing Sevilla's right-back **Juanlu Sánchez** as a potential replacement for Pierre Kalulu to strengthen their defensive options, particularly on the right flank, with preparations for a January move underway.[3][6] Reliable journalist Gianluca Di Marzio reports this interest, aligning with Napoli's prior attention on Sánchez, amid Sevilla's considerations to use him in a potential swap for Napoli striker Lorenzo Lucca, though no formal offers have been made yet.[1][5] Sánchez remains active for Sevilla, featuring in recent predicted lineups against Villarreal and Athletic Bilbao.[4][8][9]
